topic: How to become an independent watchmaker
title: Mastering Independent Watchmaking
description: A comprehensive 5-module course covering everything you need to know about independent watchmaking. Learn practical skills, master key concepts, and gain hands-on experience through structured exercises and real-world applications.

modules.title: Understanding Watch Mechanics
objectives: Learn the fundamental components of mechanical watches
Identify different types of watch mechanisms

concepts.title: Watch Movement Basics
concepts.content: The heart of every mechanical watch is its movement - a complex system of gears, springs, and escapements that work together to keep accurate time.
concepts.keyTakeaway: The escapement is the soul of the watch, controlling the release of energy from the mainspring.

concepts.title: Essential Components
concepts.content: Key components include the mainspring (power source), gear train (transfers energy), escapement (regulates timing), and balance wheel (oscillates to measure time).
concepts.keyTakeaway: Each component must work in perfect harmony for accurate timekeeping.

exercises.title: Component Identification
exercises.description: Study high-resolution images of watch movements and identify each major component

exercises.title: Movement Disassembly Practice
exercises.description: Using a practice movement, carefully disassemble and reassemble the components

modules.title: Essential Tools and Workspace Setup
objectives: Identify and understand essential watchmaking tools
Set up a proper workspace for watch repair
Learn proper tool handling and maintenance

concepts.title: Core Tool Set
concepts.content: Essential tools include screwdrivers, case openers, movement holders, loupes, tweezers, and timing equipment. Quality tools are crucial for precision work.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Invest in quality tools from the beginning - they are essential for professional results.

concepts.title: Workspace Organization
concepts.content: A clean, well-lit workspace with proper organization prevents lost parts and contamination. Anti-magnetic mats and dust-free environments are essential.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Organization and cleanliness are as important as technical skill in watchmaking.

exercises.title: Tool Familiarization
exercises.description: Handle and practice with each essential tool to build muscle memory

exercises.title: Workspace Setup Challenge
exercises.description: Design and set up an efficient workspace layout for watchmaking

modules.title: Basic Watch Repair Techniques
objectives: Learn to diagnose common watch problems
Practice precision handling of small components

concepts.title: Diagnostic Methods
concepts.content: Systematic diagnosis involves listening to the watch, examining the movement visually, and testing various functions to identify issues.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Proper diagnosis is half the repair - take time to understand the problem before acting.

concepts.title: Precision Techniques
concepts.content: Working with watch components requires steady hands, proper lighting, and precise movements. Develop consistent techniques for handling delicate parts.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Patience and precision are more valuable than speed in watchmaking.

exercises.title: Problem Diagnosis Practice
exercises.description: Practice diagnosing issues in various non-functional watch movements

exercises.title: Component Replacement
exercises.description: Replace worn or damaged components in practice movements

modules.title: Watch Assembly and Regulation
objectives: Learn proper assembly techniques for watch movements
Master the art of precise adjustment

concepts.title: Assembly Order
concepts.content: Proper assembly follows a specific sequence to ensure all components mesh correctly. The order matters for both function and accessibility.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Following proper assembly sequence prevents damage and ensures optimal performance.

concepts.title: Timing and Regulation
concepts.content: Regulation involves adjusting the balance wheel and escapement to achieve accurate timekeeping. This requires understanding of rate variations and beat adjustment.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Good regulation is the difference between a timepiece and a precision instrument.

exercises.title: Complete Movement Assembly
exercises.description: Assemble a complete movement from individual components

exercises.title: Timing Machine Practice
exercises.description: Use timing equipment to measure and adjust watch accuracy

modules.title: Building Your Independent Practice
objectives: Understand the business aspects of independent watchmaking
Learn about sourcing parts and materials
Develop customer relations and service procedures

concepts.title: Business Foundation
concepts.content: Independent watchmaking requires business skills including customer service, pricing, inventory management, and quality assurance procedures.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Technical skill must be paired with business acumen for successful independence.

concepts.title: Professional Standards
concepts.content: Maintaining professional standards includes warranty policies, documentation, and continuous education to stay current with new techniques and technologies.
concepts.keyTakeaway: Professional reputation is built on consistent quality and reliable service.

exercises.title: Business Plan Development
exercises.description: Create a basic business plan for your independent watchmaking practice

exercises.title: Customer Service Scenarios
exercises.description: Practice handling various customer situations and service requests
